citations.narrative:
Space. Insufficient space was being provided in the following enclosures:
* The last enclosure on the left side of the building measured 144 inches by 24 inches or 3456 square inches of floor
space. A total of 90 weanling guinea pigs were housed in this enclosure. Can not house more than 57 weanling guinea
pigs in this size enclosure.
* The top right weanling enclosure measured 81 inches by 32 inches or 2592 square inches of floor space. A total 50
weanling guinea pigs were housed in this enclosure. Can not house more than 43 weanling guinea pigs in this size
enclosure.
Weanling guinea pigs weighing up to 350 grams require at least 60 inches of floor space each. Inadequate space can
cause stress and aggression in animals which can result in fighting, bites, and other injuries. Licensee must ensure that
guinea pigs are provided with at least the minimum amount of floor space per animal to prevent stress, aggression, and
discomfort. Correct by April 18, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.28(c)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Space. Insufficient space was being provided in the following enclosures: 
* The last enclosure on the left side of the building measured 144 inches by 24 inches or 3456 square inches of floor 
space. A total of 90 weanling guinea pigs were housed in this enclosure. Can not house more than 57 weanling guinea 
pigs in this size enclosure. 
 
* The top right weanling enclosure measured 81 inches by 32 inches or 2592 square inches of floor space. A total 50 
weanling guinea pigs were housed in this enclosure. Can not house more than 43 weanling guinea pigs in this size 
enclosure. 
 
Weanling guinea pigs weighing up to 350 grams require at least 60 inches of floor space each. Inadequate space can 
cause stress and aggression in animals which can result in fighting, bites, and other injuries. Licensee must ensure that 
guinea pigs are provided with at least the minimum amount of floor space per animal to prevent stress, aggression, and 
discomfort. Correct by April 18, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
